title: Bank warehouse line and co-lending to scale Zelo’s SME invoice financing
description: IHC’s newly rebranded Zelo is an ADGM FSRA-regulated, digital invoice financing platform that converts approved invoices into working capital within 24–48 hours and has already deployed over USD 200M across 9,000+ transactions. Banks can partner to provide warehouse lines or co-lend against Zelo-originated receivables, accelerating deployment into the USD 250B MENA SME credit gap while leveraging Zelo’s tech-enabled underwriting and servicing.
example:
• Emirates NBD provides an AED 400m senior warehouse line to a Zelo SPV, with Zelo taking the junior/first-loss tranche. Zelo originates and services receivables from UAE SMEs in construction and logistics, enabling the bank to efficiently deploy capital into granular, short-tenor assets. This improves bank risk-adjusted yield and SME access to credit.
• First Abu Dhabi Bank (FAB) co-lends on a 80/20 basis with Zelo on insured invoices from healthcare providers billing major insurers, reducing FAB’s underwriting friction while expanding SME reach.
• Mashreq Bank sets up a referral-and-decline program: SMEs declined for traditional credit are redirected to Zelo’s 24–48 hour invoice finance, preserving the bank relationship and generating fee income.
roadmap: Align on asset class and target sectors (e.g., construction, logistics, healthcare) and data-sharing framework
Bank due diligence on Zelo’s underwriting models, collections, and FSRA compliance
Set up SPV and legal docs (MLA, servicing, eligibility criteria, concentration limits, first-loss)
Integrate bank risk reporting with Zelo’s loan tape and portfolio dashboards
Pilot AED 50–100m for 90 days across 50–100 SMEs; monitor defaults/DSO/payor concentration
Scale to AED 300–500m, add co-lending and risk-sharing enhancements
Explore securitization or note issuance via ADGM to diversify funding sources
source_name: IHC Completes Acquisition of eFunder and Rebrands the Platform as Zelo to Strengthen SME Capital Access in the UAE

title: Anchor-led supply chain finance for large UAE corporates
description: Zelo’s 24–48 hour receivables funding and automated decisions can be embedded into anchor corporate supplier programs to shorten 60–120 day payment cycles in priority industries (construction, logistics, healthcare, industrial services, oil & gas), directly addressing SME cash flow gaps.
example:
• ADNOC launches a supplier early-payment program with Zelo, enabling approved vendors to receive up to 90% of invoice value within 48 hours while preserving ADNOC’s standard terms; Zelo is repaid at maturity by the anchor, reducing SME DSO and stabilizing project delivery.
• Emaar Properties works with Zelo to finance progress-payment invoices for Tier-2/Tier-3 subcontractors on large builds, mitigating project delays caused by subcontractor cash constraints.
• DP World and JAFZA integrate Zelo into their vendor portals to offer on-demand invoice advances to port, logistics, and free-zone service providers.
roadmap: Select anchor corporates and map payor workflows and supplier segments
Agree on eligibility criteria (approved invoice status, dispute process, maximum tenor)
Integrate Zelo with anchor’s supplier portal for invoice status and approvals
Launch pilot with 50–200 suppliers; provide onboarding and pricing education
Expand to full supplier base and adjacent entities; add dynamic discounting option
Introduce performance-based line increases and automated renewals
source_name: IHC Completes Acquisition of eFunder and Rebrands the Platform as Zelo to Strengthen SME Capital Access in the UAE

title: Embedded finance through ERP and procurement platforms
description: Given Zelo’s digital onboarding and automated funding decisions, embedding financing within ERP/procurement and accounting systems can create one-click invoice finance for SMEs, leveraging Zelo’s regulated status and proven transaction volume.
example:
• SAP Ariba: Zelo integrates with Ariba for UAE anchors so suppliers can request advance funding at invoice approval, with status synced back to Ariba.
• Oracle NetSuite: Zelo app in SuiteApp Marketplace enables SMEs to submit approved invoices for instant funding from within NetSuite, reducing admin and errors.
• Zoho Books UAE: An embedded Zelo widget offers pre-approved limits based on invoice history and customer quality, enabling same-day liquidity.
roadmap: Prioritize platforms (SAP Ariba, Oracle NetSuite, Zoho Books) and define APIs
Build and certify connectors; co-market with platform partners
Run beta with 20–50 SMEs per platform; validate UX and funding SLAs
Roll out broadly; add risk signals from platform data (payment history, disputes)
Enable white-label versions for large anchors’ private marketplaces
Measure adoption and iterate pricing/limits based on platform usage
source_name: IHC Completes Acquisition of eFunder and Rebrands the Platform as Zelo to Strengthen SME Capital Access in the UAE

title: Trade credit insurance-backed invoice finance
description: To lower cost of capital and broaden eligibility, Zelo can wrap eligible receivables with trade credit insurance. This aligns with Zelo’s receivables-based model and FSRA oversight, improving recoveries and bankability for co-lenders.
example:
• Allianz Trade (Euler Hermes) provides whole-turnover or single-buyer coverage for a Zelo portfolio of industrial services invoices, enabling cheaper senior funding.
• Coface underwrites logistics sector payors across GCC, expanding Zelo’s advance rates and maximum tenor for cross-border invoices.
• Etihad Credit Insurance (ECI) supports export receivables of UAE manufacturers financed by Zelo, adding sovereign-backed protection and improving pricing.
roadmap: Identify sectors/payors with strong insurability and claims history
RFP to insurers for policy terms (coverage %, LCAs, exclusions)
Negotiate tri-party agreements (Zelo–SME–Insurer) and assignment of proceeds
Integrate policy monitoring and buyer limit checks into Zelo’s engine
Reprice warehouse lines using insured portfolio economics
Scale to additional sectors and buyers; monitor claims KPIs
source_name: IHC Completes Acquisition of eFunder and Rebrands the Platform as Zelo to Strengthen SME Capital Access in the UAE

title: Marketplace seller financing and revenue-based advances
description: Zelo offers revenue-based financing alongside invoice finance. Partnering with leading UAE marketplaces enables on-platform advances against settlement receivables, matching Zelo’s digital-first, 24–48 hour funding strengths.
example:
• noon.com integrates Zelo to offer approved sellers advances against upcoming settlements, improving seller inventory turns and GMV.
• Amazon.ae works with Zelo to prepay a percentage of FBA seller receivables, smoothing cash flow during seasonal peaks.
• Talabat enables Zelo to advance weekly payouts to restaurants with strong order histories, helping fund working capital for supplies and staffing.
roadmap: Sign data-sharing agreements and define eligibility (GMV, cancellation rates, returns)
Build APIs to receive real-time sales and settlement data
Launch a controlled pilot (e.g., 200 sellers) with clear pricing and limits
Automate collections via settlement deduction to reduce risk
Scale to broader seller base; introduce loyalty pricing for repeat users
Jointly market within seller portals and webinars
source_name: IHC Completes Acquisition of eFunder and Rebrands the Platform as Zelo to Strengthen SME Capital Access in the UAE

title: Instant disbursement and automated collections via payment processors
description: Zelo’s promise of fast liquidity can be enhanced through integrations with UAE payment processors to enable instant payouts and automated repayments, aligning with its digital onboarding and automated decisioning.
example:
• Network International enables instant settlement to SME cards or accounts when Zelo funds an invoice, improving the 24–48 hour SLA to near-instant.
• Magnati (FAB) integrates direct debit and settlement routing so Zelo can auto-collect from client receipts on due dates, reducing delinquencies.
• Stripe UAE connects with Zelo so platform merchants can receive advances and repay from Stripe settlement flows.
roadmap: Agree on payout rails (instant transfers, cards, real-time account credits) and fees
Build two-way reconciliation and mandate management (UAEDDS) for collections
Pilot instant funding for a subset of SMEs; compare DPD and churn vs. standard flow
Roll out auto-collection mandates to reduce manual follow-ups
Offer pricing discounts for SMEs opting into automated repayment
Extend to cross-border payouts where supported
source_name: IHC Completes Acquisition of eFunder and Rebrands the Platform as Zelo to Strengthen SME Capital Access in the UAE

title: Healthcare receivables financing with hospital groups and insurers
description: Healthcare providers in the UAE often face 60–120 day insurer payment cycles. Zelo can finance approved claims invoices to unlock working capital, leveraging its receivables-based model and automated decisions.
example:
• SEHA (Abu Dhabi Health Services) supplier network: Zelo finances approved claims and service invoices to SEHA’s vendors, improving supplier stability and care continuity.
• Daman (National Health Insurance Company) claim receivables: Clinics and hospitals use Zelo to advance approved claims, enabling staffing and equipment purchases.
• Mediclinic Middle East partners with Zelo to pre-finance receivables from major insurers, lowering DSO and procurement bottlenecks.
roadmap: Map claim approval and remittance advice flows with providers and insurers
Define eligibility (approved/no-dispute claims, historical denial rates)
Set up data feeds for claim approval status and expected payment dates
Pilot with a mid-sized hospital group; track DSO reduction and bad debt
Scale across network providers; add tiered pricing by insurer quality
Bundle medical equipment vendor payments with Zelo advances
source_name: IHC Completes Acquisition of eFunder and Rebrands the Platform as Zelo to Strengthen SME Capital Access in the UAE

title: Logistics and freight invoice finance for forwarders and 3PLs
description: Zelo already targets logistics as a priority sector. Partnering with major logistics ecosystems can unlock finance for freight forwarders and 3PLs dealing with long B2B payment terms, aligning with Zelo’s 24–48 hour liquidity proposition.
example:
• DP World partners with Zelo to offer invoice finance to JAFZA-based freight forwarders billing multinational shippers, reducing DSO and enabling fleet expansion.
• Aramex onboards select enterprise accounts receivables to Zelo for factoring, smoothing cash flow during peak seasons.
• DHL Express Middle East works with Zelo to finance B2B receivables from corporate accounts, optimizing working capital for last-mile operations.
roadmap: Identify target sub-segments (freight forwarders, customs brokers, warehousing providers)
Set payor whitelist and concentration caps by shipper/anchor
Integrate invoice status data with logistics platforms/portals where possible
Launch a 100+ SME pilot; evaluate seasonality and dispute rates
Introduce fuel/lease vendor payments tied to financed invoices
Scale across lanes and anchors; add insurance for cross-border invoices
source_name: IHC Completes Acquisition of eFunder and Rebrands the Platform as Zelo to Strengthen SME Capital Access in the UAE
